parameters.description: The first of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token.
parameters.name: firstCode

parameters.description: The second of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token.
parameters.name: secondCode

parameters.description: The UUID of the token to be resynchronized.
parameters.name: tokenId

firstCode.description: The first of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token

secondCode.description: The second of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token

tokenId.description: The UUID of the token to be resynchronized

post.description:
Resynchronizing requires two consecutive token codes
             (which helps to ensure that the caller is in physical possesion of the token, not just of a
             single copied token code).  Assuming that the supplied token codes can be found, TOTP resync
             will compute a new interval delta value that will be stored with the token, and HOTP resync
             will find the matching counter value (always looking forward, never backward) and update
             the counter stored with the token.
            
             Caller must either own the OATH token or be an administrator
post.summary: Resynchronize a TOTP or HOTP token.

Digits.description: The number of OTP code digits.

SmsInvite.description: Send SMS invitations to invited entities if possible (default=false)

Entities.description: Users or groups to invite; each entry is a dictionary including 'Type' (User, Group, Role), 'Guid' (entity UUID), and 'Name' (entity name, only applicable to User entities)

Role.description: Add each invited user to this role name if specified (default=null)

GroupInvite.description: For invited groups, send a single email invitation to the group rather than to each user within the group (default=true)

EmailInvite.description: Send email invitations to invited entities if possible (default=true)

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.
post.summary: Invite one or more users to the cloud portal.

parameters.description: The name or uuid of the user to check.
parameters.name: user

post.description: You must be a system administrator, have user management permissions, or be checking yourself.
post.summary: Checks to see if a given user is cloud locked.

parameters.description:
The name or uuid of the user to test. Pass an empty string to test the
            currently logged-in user.  Note that only administrative users can test other users.
parameters.name: user

post.summary: Determine if the current user can (or cannot...) satisfy the requisite MFA challenges.

parameters.description: The name or uuid of the user to check.
parameters.name: user

post.description: You must be a system administrator, have user management permissions, or be checking yourself.
post.summary: Checks to see if a given user is subject to cloud locks.

parameters.description: The name or UUID of the user to remove.
parameters.name: ID

post.description:
You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.  Will delete cloud users.  Users for other directory services are only removed from the cloud.
            This API will fail if the id specified is the current user.
post.summary: Remove a user from the cloud.

Users.description: List of user UUIDs to send invitations to

post.description:
You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.  Will delete cloud users.  Users for other directory services are only removed from the cloud.
            This API will fail if any of the ids specified are the current user.
post.summary: Remove one or more users.

Id.description: User UUID or name to reset security questions for

post.description: Specified user must be you or you must have user management permissions.
post.summary: Resets (clears) security questions for a user.

ID.description: User UUID or name to set password for, defaults to current user

post.description:
Specified user must be you or you must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.
            If specified user is self, current password state must require reset
post.summary:
Reset the password for current or a specified user (does not require valid current password).
            Used for lost password or expired password cases.

parameters.description: User UUID to send invitation to
parameters.name: ID

parameters.description: Should the user receiving the login mail also have their password expired? Default = true
parameters.name: Expire

post.description: You must be a system administrator.
post.summary: Send email invitation to a specified user.

ID.description: List of user UUIDs to send invitations to

post.description: You must be a system administrator.
post.summary: Send invitation emails to one or more users.

parameters.description: The name or uuid of the user to set the lock on.
parameters.name: user

parameters.description: Should the user be locked or unlocked?
parameters.name: lockUser

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions. The locked user will have all auth sessions removed and OAuth2 tokens revoked.
post.summary: Applies or clears a cloud lock for a given user.

ID.description: User UUID or name to set security question for

post.summary: Set the phone pin for a user.

parameters.description: Unique identifier or name of user.
parameters.name: userUuidOrName

post.summary: Uncache the user preferences.

Added.description: List of entities specifying questions to add.  Each question entity has the following properties: 'Uuid' (string, uuid of admin question) -OR- 'QuestionText' (string, text of user question), 'Answer' (string, text of answer)

Id.description: User UUID or name to update security questions for

Deleted.description: List of Uuids of questions to delete

Replace.description: Replace all existing questions with this update.

post.summary: Updates security questions for a user.

PreferredCulture.description: Centrify supported culture code. Use Core/GetSupportedCultures for a list. Set to an empty string to remove the user's preferred culture.

post.summary: Updates various user preferences for the currently logged in user.
